text:
I was visiting relatives in West Florida and I was getting eaten alive by mosquitoes even though I wore insect repellent. I decided to go into a random store that I thought sold outdoor gear because I needed a long sleeve shirt just from looking in the store windows, called 5.11 . I had NO idea that it was a ‚Äútactical‚Äù gear store so focused on militia/ former law enforcement types but marketed like ‚Äúadventure gear‚Äù. I walked in and it was like the record scratch moment- everyone was white and their jaws literally dropped. 

When I looked at a tag on a pair of cute pants and saw that it marketed being able to hold a concealed pistol in the side pocket, I realized that I was not in an off-brand REI. I decided to go with it though. I walked up to a sale associate and said ‚ÄúHi- I‚Äôm looking for a long sleeve outdoor shirt with embedded insect repellent, and SPF 50 coating. This is an adventure store, right?‚Äù  The sales associate turned bright red and mumbled ‚Äúoh, I don‚Äôt think we have that.‚Äù  I smiled sweetly at her and said ‚ÄúOh, you should tell your managers to think about selling those- looks like your clientele could use some SPF protection.‚Äù  Then walked out. LOL LOL

text:
I was in the forgotten borough of NYC the other day and stopped at a red light. At the bus stop was a black man, a black woman, a Hispanic man, and a white woman just chatting it up. And an Asian man a few feet away just listening to his earbuds. And I thought, why can't the rest of the USA be like this? 

Being from NYC and raised with diversity all around me, I had no idea how small the rest of the USA can be until I moved away as an adult. As a former New Yorker, I feel we hate everyone, sometimes even our own race. But we love everyone too and work together. We def talk shit on each other but we fight for each other as well. 

I love the different cultures, the different foods, the different languages, and the queers who don't hide, but shine. We all bleed and die, get over yourself. Everyone has a few A-holes in their bunch. And sometimes the A-hole is you. Just smile at Josh, damn it! Smile at everyone. Or don't. It's your choice to be ridiculous.
author: @deen.6635
